action.action-desc: Mr. Lamborn (for himself and Mr. Zeldin) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To condition assistance to the West Bank and Gaza on steps by the Palestinian Authority to end violence and terrorism against Israeli citizens.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Taylor Force Act.

section.header: Limitation on assistance to the West Bank and Gaza
section.text: Funds appropriated or otherwise made available for assistance under chapter 4 of part II of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 (22 U.S.C. 2346 et seq.; relating to the Economic Support Fund) and available for assistance for the West Bank and Gaza may only be made available for such purpose if the Secretary of State certifies to the appropriate congressional committees that the Palestinian Authority—

paragraph.text: is taking credible steps to end acts of violence against United States and Israeli citizens that are perpetrated by individuals under its jurisdictional control, such as the March 2016 attack that killed former United States Army officer Taylor Force, a veteran of the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan;
is publicly condemning such acts of violence and is taking steps to investigate or is cooperating in investigations of such acts to bring the perpetrators to justice; and

has terminated payments for acts of terrorism against United States and Israeli citizens to any individual who has been imprisoned after being fairly tried and convicted for such acts of terrorism and to any individual who died committing such acts of terrorism, including to a family member of such individuals.

section.text: In this Act, the term appropriate congressional committees means—

paragraph.text: the Committee on Appropriations and the Committee on Foreign Relations of the Senate; and
the Committee on Appropriations and the Committee on Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives.
